title: Thin Slab Serif & Stencil font-Editorial
content:
I'm looking for a new slab serif that has some extremely thin weights and some heavier weights for a headline font. Are there any good new ones floating around now that have not been used to bits?

Its for a mens magazine, so I am looking for something that doesn't feel dainty. Ideally I'm looking for something geometric. I've included two samples of one treatment I'd use with the font, making a stencil out of it. Would greatly appreciate any suggestions.

Thanks

nick

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [NYCLogo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131119122704/http:/typophile.com/files/NYCLogo.jpg) | 62.17 KB |
| [!!! font.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131119122704/http:/typophile.com/files/!!!%20font.png) | 20.17 KB |
author: nickmix

comments.content:
thanks, this could be very interesting. Was also looking at Soho by Sebastian Lester. Both good options. But have just realized British GQ uses Soho a lot.

best,  
Nick

\> slab serif that has some extremely thin weights

Have a look at this [list of thin fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131119122704/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/extra-thin-ultra-light-fonts/).

thanks stephen, exactly what I was looking for!

nick
Thanks for that list, Stephen, it's really useful.
